Hello Families,

Tomorrow, Thursday, September 10th is our Remote Learning Day. Students will be sent home with their Chromebooks to complete their work. If you do not have internet access, there are various places you can go to get access to internet.

In the Ivy Bend area, you can go to the food pantry and the fire station.

In the Stover area, you can come to the school and in the parking lot and use the internet from the school.

In the Florence are, if you need internet, please contact the school and we will tell you how to access internet in that area.

Students are able to still complete their assignments on their Chromebooks without internet access. Students will need to go to an internet hotspot and download their assignments to their Chromebook, and then they can complete them at home without internet. When they come to school Friday morning, they can upload the assignments, back into their Google Classroom.

If you need more instructions, they were sent to you via Parent Square. If you need more help let us know

You know school is back in session because of the increase in traffic! Please remember to practice safety and kindness around our school buses.

Standard school bus stop laws:
-Motorists coming toward a school bus must stop when the bus displays flashing red warning lights and extend the stop signal arm. These signals show that children are getting on or off the school bus.
-Vehicles may not pass until the flashing red lights and signals are turned off.
-Drivers traveling in the same direction as the bus are always required to stop.
-Never pass on the right side of the bus, where children enter or exit. This is illegal and can have tragic results.

Jason will be the new Band Director, He received his BS degree in Instrumental Music Education (2008), his MS in Education Theory and Practice (2010), and his Specialist degree in Education Leadership (2013) all from Arkansas State University.

When asked why he was excited to be teaching at MCR-1, he said, "For the last four years I have been keenly aware of the many great things happening at Stover thanks to my wife, Trisha Payne, a 3rd-grade teacher in the school. Clearly, MCR-1 is a great school with dedicated teachers, administrators, and faculty, and I am so excited to join that team and begin working towards the mission statement of striving for the best so we can rise above the rest."

Welcome to the #BulldogNation Mr. Payne! We are excited to have you as part of our family!

Today is the last day to order. Please help out these families if you can.

The Stover Student Council along with some other community members have come together to raise funds for both Keira Miller and Donovan Bartlett. All money raised from the t-shirt sales will be divided between the two families. United together we can help these families fight their battle with cancer. We are Bulldog Strong!

Keira will be in seventh grade and has been diagnosed with leukemia. Donovan will be a senior and has been diagnosed with nasopharyngeal carcinoma which is cancer in his sinuses, head, and throat. Both students and their families have a long road ahead and we want to help them out. Please consider buying a shirt and/or a bracelet. Thank you!
